p: To develop plans and policies for intervention strategies, a preliminary knowledge of disease determinants is necessary ( 79). COVID-19 was immediately defined as a contact-transmissible infectious disease, spread via direct contact between individuals. Outbreak control measures were thus aimed at reducing the amount of mixing in the population to delay the peak and reduce the final size of the epidemic ( 80). However, the course of the COVID-19 epidemic is defined by a series of further key factors, some of which are still poorly understood ( 1). The amount of scientific data produced during the COVID-19 pandemic is amazingly huge, and this can be crucial to translate research into effective public health policies and practices.
